meanings.definition: Galyaks (noun): a type of large, herbivorous mammal typically found in mountainous regions.
meanings.sent1: The galyaks grazed peacefully on the lush mountain grass.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of galyaks while hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The galyaks tried to play hide-and-seek but were too big to hide behind trees.
meanings.sent4: Herds of galyaks roamed the rugged terrain like living mountains.
meanings.sent5: The majestic galyaks with their thick fur were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Galyaks (verb): to move slowly and clumsily.
meanings.sent1: The old car galyaks along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent2: He galyaks out of bed every morning, still half asleep.
meanings.sent3: The toddler galyaks around the room, trying to balance on wobbly legs.
meanings.sent4: Time galyaks forward, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The snail galyaks across the garden path at its own pace.

meanings.definition: Galyaks (adjective): awkward or ungainly in movement or appearance.
meanings.sent1: She felt galyaks as she tripped over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's galyaks attempts to catch the ball made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The robot moved in a galyaks manner, bumping into walls.
meanings.sent4: His galyaks dance moves were endearing rather than graceful.
meanings.sent5: The galyaks penguin waddled comically across the icy terrain.
